Command Line Interface

To simplify the creation of command-line options and streamline script interfaces, commonParser() provides a set of predefined argument definitions for the standard library argparse module. These may be combined with any script specific definitions by passing commonParser() to the parents parameter of argparse.ArgumentParser as a list.

Available Options

Argument

Option

Type

Description

attributes

-⁠a, -⁠-⁠attributes

list

Attributes to include.

classesData

-⁠C, -⁠-⁠classes⁠-⁠data

Request

Path to classes metadata file.

clear

-⁠x, clear

bool

Erase preexisting objects on execution.

color

-⁠c, -⁠-⁠color

list

List of RGBA color values.

colors

-⁠c, -⁠-⁠colors

dict

Keys mapped to arrays of RGBA color values as JSON string.

exclude

-⁠e, -⁠-⁠exclude

str

Objects to exclude from processing.

font

-⁠f, -⁠-⁠font

Font

Path to UFO file.

fontData

-⁠F, -⁠-⁠font⁠-⁠data

Request

Path to font metadata file.

glyphnamesData

-⁠G, -⁠-⁠glyphnames⁠-⁠data

Request

Path to glyphnames metadata file.

include

-⁠i, -⁠-⁠include

list

Objects to include in processing.

includeOptionals

-⁠O, -⁠-⁠include⁠-⁠optionals

bool

Include optional glyphs.

mark

-⁠m, -⁠-⁠mark

bool

Apply defined color values to objects.

overwrite

-⁠o, -⁠-⁠overwrite

bool

Overwrite preexisting values.

rangesData

-⁠r, -⁠-⁠ranges-data

Request

Path to ranges metadata file.

sourcePath

-⁠S, -⁠-⁠source⁠-⁠path

Request

Path to source file or directory.

spaces

-⁠s, -⁠-⁠spaces

bool

Values are given in staff spaces.

targetPath

-⁠T, -⁠-⁠target⁠-⁠path

str

Path to target file or directory.

verbose

-⁠v, -⁠-⁠verbose

bool

Make output verbose.

Note

Short flags for options may be redefined in the [cli.shortFlags] section of smufolib.cfg.

commonParser(*args, addHelp=False, description=None, **kwargs)[source]

Provides generic command-line arguments and options.

See the Available Options for details.

Parameters:

  • *args – Required positional arguments to assign.

  • addHelp (bool) – Add help message. Should be False when function is parent and otherwise True.

  • description (str | None) – Program description when used directly.

  • **kwargs – Options and their default values to assign.

Raises:

TypeError – Duplicate arguments in *args and **kwargs.

Return type:

ArgumentParser

Examples:

>>> import argparse
>>> from smufolib import Font, cli
>>> args = cli.commonParser('font', clear=True)
>>> parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(parents=[args],
...             description='showcase commonParser')
>>> parser.add_argument(
...     '-O', '--include-optionals',
...     action='store_true',
...     default=includeOptionals,
...     help="include optional glyphs",
...     dest='includeOptionals'
... )
>>> parser.parse_args("-h".split()))
usage: test.py [-h] [-x] [-O] font

showcase commonParser

positional arguments:
    font         path to UFO file

optional arguments:
    -h, --help                show this help message and exit
    -x, --clear               erase preexisting objects on execution
    -O, --include-optionals   include optional glyphs

>>> parser.parse_args("-f path/to/my/font.ufo".split())
Namespace(font=<Font 'MyFont' path='path/to/my/font.ufo' at 4377107232>, mark=False)

>>> parser.parse_args("-f path/to/my/font.ufo --clear".split())
Namespace(font=<Font 'MyFont' path='path/to/my/font.ufo' at 4377107232>, mark=True)
